component.title: Twitter
component.description: This component integrates with Twitter to send tweets or search for tweets and more.
component.label: api,social

httpProxyHost.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter.

httpProxyUser.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter.

httpProxyPassword.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter.

httpProxyPort.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter.

kind.description: What polling mode to use direct polling or event based. The event mode is only supported when the endpoint kind is event based.

accessToken.description: The access token. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

accessTokenSecret.description: The access secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

consumerKey.description: The consumer key. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

consumerSecret.description: The consumer secret. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

user.description: Username used for user timeline consumption direct message production etc.

bridgeErrorHandler.label: consumer
bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages or the likes will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.label: consumer
sendEmptyMessageWhenIdle.description: If the polling consumer did not poll any files you can enable this option to send an empty message (no body) instead.

type.label: consumer
type.description: Endpoint type to use. Only streaming supports event type.

distanceMetric.label: consumer,advanced
distanceMetric.description: Used by the non-stream geography search to search by radius using the configured metrics. The unit can either be mi for miles or km for kilometers. You need to configure all the following options: longitude latitude radius and distanceMetric.

exceptionHandler.label: consumer,advanced
exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this options is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions that will be logged at WARN/ERROR level and ignored.

exchangePattern.label: consumer,advanced
exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange.

latitude.label: consumer,advanced
latitude.description: Used by the non-stream geography search to search by latitude. You need to configure all the following options: longitude latitude radius and distanceMetric.

locations.label: consumer,advanced
locations.description: Bounding boxes created by pairs of lat/lons. Can be used for streaming/filter. A pair is defined as latlon. And multiple paris can be separated by semi colon.

longitude.label: consumer,advanced
longitude.description: Used by the non-stream geography search to search by longitude. You need to configure all the following options: longitude latitude radius and distanceMetric.

pollStrategy.label: consumer,advanced
pollStrategy.description: A pluggable org.apache.camel.PollingConsumerPollingStrategy allowing you to provide your custom implementation to control error handling usually occurred during the poll operation before an Exchange have been created and being routed in Camel.

radius.label: consumer,advanced
radius.description: Used by the non-stream geography search to search by radius. You need to configure all the following options: longitude latitude radius and distanceMetric.

twitterStream.label: consumer,advanced
twitterStream.description: To use a custom instance of TwitterStream

synchronous.label: advanced
synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

count.label: consumer,filter
count.description: Limiting number of results per page.

filterOld.label: consumer,filter
filterOld.description: Filter out old tweets that has previously been polled. This state is stored in memory only and based on last tweet id.

keywords.label: consumer,filter
keywords.description: Can be used for search and streaming/filter. Multiple values can be separated with comma.

lang.label: consumer,filter
lang.description: The lang string ISO_639-1 which will be used for searching

numberOfPages.label: consumer,filter
numberOfPages.description: The number of pages result which you want camel-twitter to consume.

sinceId.label: consumer,filter
sinceId.description: The last tweet id which will be used for pulling the tweets. It is useful when the camel route is restarted after a long running.

userIds.label: consumer,filter
userIds.description: To filter by user ids for streaming/filter. Multiple values can be separated by comma.

backoffErrorThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffErrorThreshold.description: The number of subsequent error polls (failed due some error) that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffIdleThreshold.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffIdleThreshold.description: The number of subsequent idle polls that should happen before the backoffMultipler should kick-in.

backoffMultiplier.label: consumer,scheduler
backoffMultiplier.description: To let the scheduled polling consumer backoff if there has been a number of subsequent idles/errors in a row. The multiplier is then the number of polls that will be skipped before the next actual attempt is happening again. When this option is in use then backoffIdleThreshold and/or backoffErrorThreshold must also be configured.

greedy.label: consumer,scheduler
greedy.description: If greedy is enabled then the ScheduledPollConsumer will run immediately again if the previous run polled 1 or more messages.

initialDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
initialDelay.description: Milliseconds before the first poll starts. You can also specify time values using units such as 60s (60 seconds) 5m30s (5 minutes and 30 seconds) and 1h (1 hour).

runLoggingLevel.label: consumer,scheduler
runLoggingLevel.description: The consumer logs a start/complete log line when it polls. This option allows you to configure the logging level for that.

scheduledExecutorService.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduledExecutorService.description: Allows for configuring a custom/shared thread pool to use for the consumer. By default each consumer has its own single threaded thread pool.

scheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
scheduler.description: To use a cron scheduler from either camel-spring or camel-quartz2 component

schedulerProperties.label: consumer,scheduler
schedulerProperties.description: To configure additional properties when using a custom scheduler or any of the Quartz2 Spring based scheduler.

startScheduler.label: consumer,scheduler
startScheduler.description: Whether the scheduler should be auto started.

timeUnit.label: consumer,scheduler
timeUnit.description: Time unit for initialDelay and delay options.

useFixedDelay.label: consumer,scheduler
useFixedDelay.description: Controls if fixed delay or fixed rate is used. See ScheduledExecutorService in JDK for details.

httpProxyHost.label: proxy
httpProxyHost.description: The http proxy host which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

httpProxyPassword.label: proxy
httpProxyPassword.description: The http proxy password which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

httpProxyPort.label: proxy
httpProxyPort.description: The http proxy port which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.

httpProxyUser.label: proxy
httpProxyUser.description: The http proxy user which can be used for the camel-twitter. Can also be configured on the TwitterComponent level instead.
